ratings.comment: Kines 100 is not worth the effort

I think Carda is a great lecturer and makes the class very interesting to listen to. That being said, the exams for this class are far above the 100 level. I have found the exams to be highly specific and often reference niche details. f you have the time to invest in his class, it's rewarding. If you're taking hard classes, it'll be annoying.

This was an amazing class, I'd recommend it to everyone. Super interesting. You will ace the tests if you learn the content by answering the review questions given with each lecture. The professor is extremely passionate, all lectures are posted online. Packback questions are easy, engaging and basically free grades. Loved everything about it

The test questions are based off of the review questions given. They can be based off of something he says in class, so pay attention during lecture. The tests are specific, so study for them despite the class being easy. He keeps the class interesting.

I really liked the content that was covered in each lecture, but the tests were very specific. My best advice is to study all the review questions that he gives for each lecture when preparing for the test.

Easily one of the best lecturers I've ever had. Professor Carda is an extremely passionate and engaging speaker that really makes you care and apply the material you learn in class. While the exam content can be a bit specific, completing the provided review questions provided should be enough to do well on the exams. Overall a very fun 100 class.

While professor Carda is an extremely passionate instructor who makes class interesting, the exams are much more difficult than I feel they should be. For a 100 class, the exams contain difficult questions that contain very specific information from the slides and are often unattainable and difficult to receive high scores on.

I definitely do not recommend this class. Tests are too specific and more challenging than the material presented on the slides (which he ensures will only be on the test). Exams are 85% of your final grades and the averages were not great on them. Definitely too complex for a 100-level class.

There is no reason a 100 level course was this difficult. The lectures were interesting and I thought I understood the material, but the exams and quizzes were so difficult to understand, without any background in kinesiology, it would be very hard to do well in this class.

As a lecturer, he's pretty good. He's clearly passionate about what he teaches and cracks a joke from time to time. The packback posts are basically free points. There's three tests (curved) that have some pretty specific questions, so I'd recommend not going into a test w/out studying important lecture concepts unless you have really good memory.

He really cares about what he is teaching, but the first part of his lectures are very boring but then 5 minutes before class ends he gets interesting. He is a hard grader, and the tests are very specific. For it being a 100 level class, it should not be as hard as he makes it.

If you need a class to fall asleep in, this is your guy. He sounds like a typical, old professor and it can be really hard to pay attention. The class is super easy. There are 3 tests, not cumuluative. Content is interesting, but a lot of it is common sense, or you can learn it in anatomy/bio. Uses Honorlock if you're still online, but no cam/mic.
Tests are worth a high percentage of the grade, but the prof is amazing. He's very animated and it shows he is super passionate about his work. I'd love to take more of his classes. He made them fun.
